benchmark_details.name: Role-playing-Video60k
benchmark_details.overview: Role-playing-Video60k is a large-scale, high-quality dataset comprising 60k videos and 700k corresponding dialogues, aimed at developing role-playing agents (RPAs) by integrating dynamic role profiles through video modalities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To create a dataset that allows for the development of immersive role-playing agents by incorporating dynamic video information.

data.source: Videos sourced from various social media platforms such as Xiaohongshu, Douyin, Weibo, and Bilibili.
data.format: video files with accompanying captions and dialogues
data.annotation: Annotated using a combination of LLM-generated captions and manual adjustments.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated through evaluations involving both LLM assessments and human judgments.
methodology.interpretation: Metrics reflect the quality, consistency, and human-like nature of responses generated by RPAs.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared against multiple existing models including InternVL2.5 with and without video modality.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments with various evaluation metrics to validate the effectiveness of the developed framework.
